Class AskData

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • AskData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class AskData
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The AskData class is the class that extends the JPanel and ask the user for their name.
    Version:
    5 06.09.15 Time Spent by Jasmine Ou: 4 hours. Time Spent by Laura Wong: 4 hours.

    name: AskName.java

    Instance Variables:

    name This is the string variable to store the user's name.

    difficultyNum This is an int variable that keeps track of the number of virtual days.

    critter This is a string variable that keeps track of the colour of the user's critter.

    userName This is the user name text field where the user enters their user name.

    okButton This is the button for the user to enter all their data.

    easyButton This is is the easy button for the easy level.

    mediumButton This is is the medium button for the medium level.

    hardButton This is is the hard button for the hard level.

    redButton This is the button for the red critter.

    blueButton This is the button for the blue critter.

    purpleButton This is the button for the purple critter.

    orangeButton This is the button for the orange critter.

    yellowButton This is the button for the yellow critter.

    Author:
    Jasmine Ou and Laura Wong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AskData

        public AskData()
        The AskData constructor is used to create the fields, buttons and labels for the user to enter their information.

        Local variables:

        askTheName This is the label that asks the user for their name.

        difficultyLabel This is the difficulty label that asks the user for it's difficulty.

        insets This is the inset variable for positioning the buttons and label.

        size This is the dimension variable for positioning and getting the size of the buttons and the label.

        difficultyGroup This is a group of buttons for the difficulty radio buttons.

        radioPanel This is a radio panel where the radio buttons are added on to.

        colorGroup This is a group of buttons for the different coloured critter radio button options.

    • Method Detail

      • setButtonsActionListener

        public void setButtonsActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
        The setButtonsActionListener method is used to add action listener to the all the radio buttons and the ok button. An appropriate action command is set to the components with the action listener.
        Parameters:
        al - This is the ActionListener varaible.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This getName method is used to return the user's name.
        Overrides:
        getName in class java.awt.Component
        Returns:
        name This is the user's String name.

      • getDifficultyNum

        public int getDifficultyNum()
        This getDifficultyNum method is used to return the user's difficulty choice.
        Returns:
        difficultyNum This is the user's int difficulty number.

      • setDifficultyNum

        public void setDifficultyNum(java.lang.String difficulty)
        This setDifficultyNum method is used to set the user's difficulty choice. If difficulty is easy, difficultyNum is 1, if medium, it is 2, else if hard, it is 3.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - This is the user's String difficulty choice.

      • getCritter

        public java.lang.String getCritter()
        This getCritter method is used to return the user's critter colour choice.
        Returns:
        critter This is the String color of the critter.

      • setCritter

        public void setCritter(java.lang.String colour)
        This setCritter method is used to set the user's critter colour choice.
        Parameters:
        colour - This is the String color of the critter.

      • checkUsername

        public boolean checkUsername()
        The checkUsername method checks if something was input as a username. If nothing was input, false is returned. Else, the input is set to the name variable and it returns true.
        Returns:
        true if a username was input and false if not.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The paintComponent method is used to create the graphics.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - this is the graphics variable that will be used to create the background colour for screen.
